name: Pitho Rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rating is very difficult in this regard. This is a property with a caring owner, at a great price, in a wonderful location. I would consider it a budget hotel --- and they pull it off well. The room we have is good sized with a balcony facing the interior (quieter). The balcony is large enough to enjoy sitting outside. I have read numerous accounts about the bathrooms/showers here. The bathrooms are an O.K. size and yes, the shower is not large. But I don't agree with people's reviews that it is unusable. This is a budget hotel and the shower is adequate. If you want an upscale room, pay for it.
reviews.title: Is this a five star budget hotel or a 3-4 star property considering everything in Delphi?

reviews.text: We are happy here and think this is a good value.
reviews.title: The warmest of welcomes

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: BTW --- the rooms are CLEAN and the beds seem comfortable. We arrived at 2:30, had lunch, walked to and visited the museum and site, and are leaving in the morning for Athens.
reviews.title: Brief but Enjoyable Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: George has been most accommodating and helpful. He really seems to care.
reviews.title: George and Vicki - Greek hospitality at its best!

reviews.text: The host George welcomed us with the warmest and most genuine smile. What a great location and lovely rooms (large enough for 3).
reviews.title: Outstanding and Amazing

reviews.text: I can't say enough good things about George at Pitho Rooms. Our flight was messed up and we didn't arrive in Athens until 1am (originally scheduled for 5pm). We called George from Paris and let him know that we wouldn't be arriving that night but instead would be driving in very early in the morning. He arranged to meet us at whatever time we arrived and told us not to worry. Turned out we drove up to the hotel at 5am. We called George and he was there in minutes to open the door and show us to our room. That is going above and beyond to care for the customer. We enjoyed their hospitality and the pleasant atmosphere. Breakfast was wonderful. The rooms were perfect - clean and comfortable. Delphi was our favorite stop in Greece.
reviews.title: Great Customer Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a lovely stay we had at Pitho Rooms. This family-run inn is so welcoming and Delphi was a highlight of our travels in Greece. George gave us a terrific suggestion on a restaurant, alerted us to the free full-moon night entry to the ancient site and chatted with us over breakfast. Our room was extremely clean, the bed was comfortable and the wi-fi was dependable. The room is what I would call a basic standard for Greece -- simple room, small bathroom with stand-up shower. We had booked through hotels-dot-com, but I wish we would have booked directly with George via e-mail so that he would not have had to pay the hotels-dot-com commission (I understand that booking-dot-com is even worse with commissions). Recommended for sure.
reviews.title: Convenient and friendly family inn

reviews.text: Pithos Rooms was located in a great location, right in the heart of Delphi, an easy walk to the historic ruins. There were plenty of places to eat and enjoy the dramatic views just steps from Pithos. The hosts were very welcoming, the room clean and comfortable and breakfast - especially the yogurt and honey - good too.
reviews.title: Great stop in Delphi!

reviews.text: We wanted to go to Delphi so flew to Athens and drove and stayed one night with George. He is a very generous and kind owner we makes you feel at home nothing is too much trouble . He was waiting for our arrival and went out of his way to enable us to see the sights. Our bed was very comfortable matress brilliant. Our adult kids had another room next door to ours and it also was excellent . I would throughly recommend George's rooms and if we come back to Delphi we will stay again .
reviews.title: Outstanding customer service

reviews.text: I picked this place based on the reviews and I am in agreement with the comments and high ratings. This is a very simple place but George and his wife go out of their way to make you feel at home. The rooms are comfortable, the breakfast is great and the location is perfect. If you are looking for a place to stay in Delphi, I highly recommend it. You won't be disappointed!
reviews.title: Great Place
Perfect spot to walk to ruins and great dinner recommendations!
reviews.text: We arrived in our rental car and were met immediately at the door by George, who assured us we had parked in an appropriate spot and helped us to bring our bags upstairs. The room was large and clean, and George was very helpful in terms of pointing us in the right direction to the sights and letting us know what to expect (w/r/t distances and opening hours). We found the Wi-Fi signal to be too weak for our iPhones, but had no issues connecting with the laptop. Vicky suggested a restaurant for us for dinner, which happened to be directly across the street and run by a family member, and this turned out to be the best meal in our first 4 days in Greece!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Delphi basically has two main roads, both one way, Pitho being on the lower one you take coming from the mountain road from Lamia. George and has wife Viki run shops on either side of the hotel so if you try to park there they will welcome you if you are staying. Parking is limited so iif you miss one of the spaces in front you it is nearly at the end of the town and I guess you do the best you can. George explained to me that during construction they could see installing an elevator was not practical so he tries to be the elevator, carrying your bags.
reviews.title: Excellent but no lift

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room had a private balcony, lots of power points and a refrigerator. Parking, wifi and breakfast are all included in the price (we paid 60 euros for double). The main historic ruin area is one kilometre away and the furthest (Athena's temple) less than two. There are good restaurants across the street from the hotel and an ATM on the way to the attractions. This hotel has everything you need for an enjoyable stay in Delphi.
reviews.title: A very nice hotel, no elevator

reviews.text: If you have knee problems, this hotel is not for you, as there is no elevator and all rooms are at least one story high. Luggage is not a problem though, as George was a physed teacher and will gladly bring it up to your room and back down. Viki recommended the restaurant right in front and the view is wonderful there, and the food, delicious. She recommended another restaurant at the end of town which was also lovely. The hotel is on the wrong side of the street if you are expecting the plunging view on the breathtaking valley, still, our room had a very nice view and was perfectly located. We definitely recommend this hotel. The room was spacious and perfectly clean, and the price was reasonable. And we received a very warm welcome and a very pleasant farewell.
reviews.title: Wonderful accommodations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stopped in Delphi on our way through Greece to visit the archaeological sites in Delphi and stayed for one night at the Pitho Rooms. We had a wonderful stay - Vassiliki welcomed us as soon as we walked through the door in their downstairs shop and George was quick to follow from the upstairs reception room. We asked for two rooms at the back of the hotel so we weren't awakened by any street noises and the rooms we were given were side by side with an exterior closing door in the hallway for extra privacy. Our balconies opened to a lovely garden retaining wall with flowers and small animal statuettes. The rooms and bathrooms in each of our rooms were clean and comfortable. George recommended an excellent restaurant with amazing views of the area and was very helpful in recommending when to go to the archaeological sites - all walking distance from the hotel.
reviews.title: Fabulous accomodations in Delphi
Friendly, helpful
reviews.text: We enjoyed our 2 day stay in this immaculately clean attractive boutique hotel in the center of town. We loved our patio with a view of an artistically designed privacy wall. The owner George is attentive to his guests every need and a great conversationalist. The included breakfast was satisfying. Try the homemade sour cherries with the fresh Greek yoghurt. A lovely hotel and a lovely historic small town to visit. The Epicurious Restaurant and Taverna across the street is the best in town but ask George for other recommendations.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A lovely place to visit Delphi. It is in the middle of the village, restaurants are close by (ask Vicky or George for advise, they gave us a perfect tip). The rooms are (for this price) excellent. The owners are very friendly and helpful.The museum and the other interesting sites are on walking distance.
reviews.title: Lovely

reviews.text: I really cannot add much more to the excellent reviews posted. A lovely place to stay, wonderful hosts, in a truly special place. We hope to visit Delphi again and would not stay anywhere else. Thank you, George & Vicky
reviews.title: A SPECIAL PLACE

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Pitho Rooms for one night. George and Vicky, the owners, are wonderful. We met Vicky when we first got to the property before we can check in and she was very welcoming. We then met George when we came back and checked-in. They were very warm, friendly, accommodating and sweet. We were the only ones staying there that night. They were getting a much needed break for a day or two, after a busy past few weeks. George served us breakfast and we really enjoyed his company and conversation.
reviews.title: Wonderful hosts!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The property is located in town just a short walk (20 minutes or so) to the archaeological site and museum, which is right next to the site. There are several restaurants and shops near-by. The room we had was spacious with a sitting area, and small balcony. The bathroom was a little small, but totally adequate. The room/bathroom was clean, bed comfortable, AC unit controlled with your own remote and worked very well.
reviews.title: Most comfortable hotel bed in Greece!

description: In Mycenaean times, Delphi, which was called "Rocky Pytho"€� by Homer, was sanctuary of a female deity, Ge, who gave oracles through a prophetess. Family-run friendly, warm atmosphere. Comfortable lounge fireplace, air-conditioning, cafe bar, central heating, bathrooms, TV set, breakfast, coffee, pastries, drinks. Emphasis on cleanliness of all rooms. The hotel is centrally located near all public services and places of interest. Things to do: visit the Archaeological Museum, the Archaeological Sites, Sikelianos, Stately Home Open Sports Centre: (Volleyball, Tennis, Basketball) shops, restaurants, cafes, bars. There is easy access to Parnassus Ski Centre and the nearby villages for one-day trips. Unique combination ofmountainous landscape, the olive groves and the sea.
